66.26: Princes went before joined with singers, in the midst of young damsels playing on timbrels.
66.27: In the churches bless ye God the Lord, from the fountains of Israel.
66.28: There is Benjamin a youth, in ecstacy of mind.
66.29: Command thy strength, O God: confirm, O God, what thou hast wrought in us.
66.30: From thy temple in Jerusalem, kings shall offer presents to thee.
66.31: Rebuke the wild beasts of the reeds, the congregation of bulls, with the kine of the people; who seek to exclude them who are tried with silver.
66.32: Scatter thou the nations that delight in wars:  ambassadors shall come out of Egypt: Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands to God.
66.33: Sing to God, ye kingdoms of the earth: sing ye to the Lord:
66.34: Sing ye to God,  who mounteth above the heaven of heavens, to the east.
66.35: Behold he will give to his voice the voice of power,  give ye glory to God, for Israel, his magnificence, and his power is in the clouds.
66.36: God is wonderful in his saints: the God of Israel is he who will give power and strength to his people. Blessed be God.

67.1: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed; for David.
67.2: Save me, O God: for the waters are come in even unto my soul.
67.3: I stick fast in the mire of the deep: and there is no sure standing.
67.4: I have laboured with crying; my jaws are become hoarse: my eyes have failed, whilst I hope in my God.
67.5: They are multiplied above the hairs of my head, who hate me without cause.
67.6: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my offences are not hidden from thee:
67.7: Let not them be ashamed for me, who look for thee, O Lord, the Lord of hosts.
67.8: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.
67.9: I am become a stranger to my brethren, and an alien to the sons of my mother.
67.10: *For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up: **and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
67.11: And I covered my soul in fasting: and it was made a reproach to me.
67.12: And I made hair-cloth my garment: and I became a bye-word to them.
67.13: They that sat in the gate spoke against me: and they that drank wine made me their song.
67.14: But as for me, my prayer is to thee, O Lord; for the time of thy good pleasure, O God.
67.15: Draw me out of the mire, that I may not stick fast: deliver me from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
67.16: Let not the tempest of water drown me, nor the deep swallow me up: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
67.17: Hear me, O Lord, for thy mercy is kind; look upon me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
67.18: And turn not away thy face from thy servant: for I am in trouble, hear me speedily.
67.19: Attend to my soul, and deliver it: save me because of my enemies.
67.20: Thou knowest my reproach, and my confusion, and my shame.
67.21: In thy sight are all they that afflict me: my heart hath expected reproach and misery.
67.22: *And they gave me gall for my food, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
67.23: *Let their table become as a snare before them, and a recompense, and a stumbling-block.
67.24: Let their eyes be darkened that they see not; and their back bend thou down always.
67.25: Pour out thy indignation upon them: and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
67.26: *Let their habitation be made desolate: and let there be none to dwell in their tabernacles.
67.27: Because they have persecuted him whom thou hast smitten; and they have added to the grief of my wounds.
67.28: Add thou iniquity upon their iniquity: and let them not come into thy justice.
67.29: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living; and with the just let them not be written.
67.30: But I am poor and sorrowful: thy salvation, O God, hath set me up.
67.31: I will praise the name of God with a canticle: and I will magnify him with praise.
67.32: And it shall please God better than a young calf, that bringeth forth horns and hoofs.
67.33: Let the poor see and rejoice: seek ye God, and your soul shall live.
67.34: For the Lord hath heard the poor: and hath not despised his prisoners.
67.35: Let the heavens and the earth praise him; the sea, and every thing that creepeth therein.
67.36: For God will save Sion, and the cities of Juda shall be built up.
67.37: And the seed of his servants shall possess it: and they that love his name, shall dwell therein.

68.1: Unto the end, a psalm for David, to bring to remembrance that the Lord saved him.
68.2: O God, come to my assistance; O Lord, make haste to help me.
68.3: Let them be confounded and ashamed that seek my soul:
68.4: Let them be turned backward, and blush for shame that desire evils to me:
68.5: Let all that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee; and let such as love thy salvation, say always: The Lord be magnified.
68.6: But I am needy and poor; O God, help me.

69.1: A psalm for David. Of the sons of Jonadab, and the former captives.
69.2: In thee, O Lord, I have hoped, let me never be put to confusion:  deliver me in thy justice, and rescue me.
69.3: Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a place of strength: that thou mayst make me safe.
69.4: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the sinner, and out of the hand of the transgressor of the law, and of the unjust.
69.5: For thou art my patience, O Lord: my hope, O Lord, from my youth.
69.6: By thee have I been confirmed from the womb: from my mother's womb thou art my protector.
69.7: Of thee shall I continually sing:  I am become unto many as a wonder, but thou art a strong helper.
69.8: Let my mouth be filled with praise, that I may sing thy glory; thy greatness all the day long.
69.9: Cast me not off in the time of old age: when my strength shall fail, do not thou forsake me.
69.10: For my enemies have spoken against me; and they that watched my soul have consulted together,
69.11: Saying: God hath forsaken him: pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver him.
69.12: O God, be not thou far from me: O my God, make haste to help me.
69.13: Let them be confounded, and come to nothing, that detract my soul; let them be covered with confusion and shame that seek my hurt.
69.14: But I will always hope; and will add to all thy praise.
69.15: My mouth shall shew forth thy justice; thy salvation all the day long.
69.16: Because I have not known learning,  I will enter into the powers of the Lord: O Lord, I will be mindful of thy justice alone.
69.17: Thou hast taught me, O God, from my youth: and till now I will declare thy wonderful works.
69.18: And unto old age and grey hairs: O God, forsake me not,
69.19: Thy power,  and thy justice, O God, even to the highest great things thou hast done: O God, who is like to thee?
69.20: How great troubles hast thou shewn me, many and grievous: and turning, thou hast brought me to life, and hast brought me back again from the depths of the earth:
69.21: Thou hast multiplied thy magnificence; and, turning to me, thou hast comforted me.
69.22: For I will also confess to thee thy truth with the instruments of psaltery: O God, I will sing to thee with the harp, thou holy one of Israel.
69.23: My lips shall greatly rejoice, when I shall sing to thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
69.24: Yea, and my tongue shall meditate on thy justice all the day; when they shall be confounded, and put to shame, that seek evils to me.

70.2: Give to the king thy judgment, O God: and to the king's son thy justice:
70.3: Let the mountains receive peace for the people, and the hills justice.
70.4: He shall judge the poor of the people, and he shall save the children of the poor; and he shall humble the oppressor.
70.5: And he shall continue with the sun, and before the moon, throughout all generations.
70.6: He shall come down like rain upon the fleece; and as showers falling gently upon the earth.
70.7: In his days shall justice spring up, and abundance of peace, till the moon be taken sway.
70.8: And he shall rule from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.
70.9: Before him the Ethiopians shall fall down; and his enemies shall lick the ground.
70.10: The kings of Tharsis and the islands shall offer presents: the kings of the Arabians and of Saba shall bring gifts;
70.11: And all kings of the earth shall adore him: all the nations shall serve him.
70.12: For he shall deliver the poor from the mighty: and the needy that had no helper.
70.13: He shall spare the poor and needy: and he shall save the souls of the poor.
70.14: He shall redeem their souls from usuries and iniquity: and their names shall be honourable in his sight.
70.15: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Arabia, for him they shall always adore: they shall bless him all the day.
70.16: And there shall be a firmament on the earth on the tops of mountains, above Libanus shall the fruit thereof be exalted: and they of the city shall flourish like the grass of the earth.
70.17: Let his name be blessed for evermore: his name continueth before the sun.
70.18: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who alone doth wonderful things.
70.19: And blessed be the name of his majesty for ever; and the whole earth shall be filled with his majesty. So be it. So be it.
70.20: The praises of David, the son of Jesse, are ended.

71.2: But my feet were almost moved; my steps had well nigh slipt.
71.3: Because I had a zeal on occasion of the wicked, seeing the prosperity of sinners.
71.4: For there is no regard to their death, nor is there strength in their stripes.
71.5: They are not in the labour of men: neither shall they be scourged like other men.
71.6: Therefore pride hath held them fast: they are covered with their iniquity and their wickedness.
71.7: Their iniquity hath come forth, as it were, from fatness: they have passed into the affection of the heart.
71.8: They have thought and spoken wickedness: they have spoken iniquity on high.
71.9: They have set their mouth against heaven: and their tongue hath passed through the earth.
71.10: Therefore will my people return here: and full days shall be found in them.
71.11: And they said: How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
71.12: Behold these are sinners; and yet abounding in the world they have obtained riches.
71.13: And I said: Then have I in vain justified my heart, and washed my hands among the innocent.
71.14: And I have been scourged all the day; and my chastisement hath been in the mornings.
71.15: If I said: I will speak thus; behold I should condemn the generation of thy children.
71.16: I studied that I might know this thing, it is a labour in my sight:
71.17: Until I go into the sanctuary of God, and understand concerning their last ends.
71.18: But indeed for deceits thou hast put it to them: when they were lifted up, thou hast cast them down.
71.19: How are they brought to desolation? they have suddenly ceased to be: they have perished by reason of their iniquity.
71.20: As the dream of them that awake, O Lord; so in thy city thou shalt bring their image to nothing.
71.21: For my heart hath been inflamed, and my reins have been changed:  and I am brought to nothing, and I knew not.
71.22: I am become as a beast before thee: and I am always with thee.
71.23: Thou hast held me by my right hand; and by thy will thou hast conducted me, and with glory thou hast received me.
71.24: For what have I in heaven? and besides thee what do I desire upon earth?
71.25: For thee my flesh and my heart hath fainted away: thou art the God of my heart, and the God that is my portion for ever.
71.26: For behold they that go far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that are disloyal to thee.
71.27: But it is good for me to adhere to my God, to put my hope in the Lord God:

72.2: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast possessed from the beginning.
72.3: Lift up thy hands against their pride unto the end; see what things the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
72.4: And they that hate thee have made their boasts, in the midst of thy solemnity.
72.5: They have set up their ensigns for signs:  and they knew not both in the going out, and on the highest top.
72.6: As with axes in a wood of trees,  they have cut down at once the gates thereof: with axe and hatchet they have brought it down.
72.7: *They have set fire to thy sanctuary: they have defiled the dwelling-place of thy name on the earth.
72.8: They said in their heart, the whole kindred of them together: Let us abolish all the festival days of God from the land.
72.9: Our signs we have not seen, there is now no prophet: and he will know us no more.
72.10: How long, O God, shall the enemy reproach? is the adversary to provoke thy name for ever?
72.11: Why dost thou turn away thy hand: and thy right hand out of the midst of thy bosom for ever?
72.12: *But God is our king before ages: he hath wrought salvation in the midst of the earth.
72.13: Thou, by thy strength, didst make the sea firm: thou didst crush the heads of the dragons in the waters.
72.14: Thou hast broken the heads of the dragon: thou hast given him to be meat for the people of the Ethiopians.
72.15: Thou hast broken up the fountains and the torrents: thou hast dried up the Ethan rivers.
72.16: Thine is the day, and thine is the night: thou hast made the morning light and the sun.
72.17: Thou hast made all the borders of the earth: the summer and the spring were formed by thee.
72.18: Remember this, the enemy hath reproached the Lord: and a foolish people hath provoked thy name.
72.19: Deliver not up to beasts the souls that confess to thee: and forget not to the end the souls of thy poor.
72.20: Have regard to thy covenant: for they that are the obscure of the earth, have been filled with dwellings of iniquity.
72.21: Let not the humble be turned away with confusion: the poor and needy shall praise thy name.
72.22: Arise, O God, judge thy own cause: remember thy reproaches with which the foolish man hath reproached thee all the day.
72.23: Forget not the voices of thy enemies: the pride of them that hate thee ascendeth continually.

73.1: Unto the end, corrupt not, a psalm of a canticle for Asaph.
73.2: We will praise thee, O God: we will praise, and we will call upon thy name.
73.3: We will relate thy wondrous works:  when I shall take a time, I will judge justices.
73.4: The earth is melted, and all that dwell therein: I have established the pillars thereof.
73.5: I said to the wicked: Do not act wickedly: and to the sinners: Lift not up the horn.
73.6: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not iniquity against God.
73.7: For neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the desert hills:  for God is the judge.
73.8: One he putteth down, and another he lifteth up:  for in the hand of the Lord there is a cup of strong wine full of mixture.
73.9: But I will declare for ever: I will sing to the God of Jacob.
73.10: And I will break all the horns of sinners: but the horns of the just shall be exalted.

74.1: Unto the end, in praises, a psalm for Asaph: a canticle to the Assyrians.
74.2: In Judea God is known: his name is great in Israel.
74.3: And his place is in peace: and his abode in Sion:
74.4: There hath he broken the powers of bows, the shield, the sword, and the battle.
74.5: Thou enlightenest wonderfully from the everlasting hills.  All the foolish of heart were troubled.
74.6: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, they have all slumbered that mounted on horseback.
74.7: Thou art terrible, and who shall resist thee? from that time thy wrath.
74.8: Thou hast caused judgment to be heard from heaven: the earth trembled and was still,
74.9: When God arose in judgment, to save all the meek of the earth.
74.10: For the thought of man shall give praise to thee: and the remainders of the thought shall keep holiday to thee.
74.11: Vow ye, and pay to the Lord your God: all you that are round about him bring presents.
74.12: To him that is terrible,  even to him who taketh away the spirit of princes: to the terrible with the kings of the earth.

75.1: Unto the end, for Idithun, a psalm of Asaph.
75.2: I cried to the Lord with my voice; to God with my voice, and he gave ear to me.
75.3: In the day of my trouble I sought God, with my hands lifted up to him in the night: and I was not deceived.
75.4: My soul refused to be comforted:  I remembered God, and was delighted, and was exercised, and my spirit swooned away.
75.5: My eyes prevented the watches: I was troubled, and I spoke not.
75.6: I thought upon the days of old: and I had in my mind the eternal years.
75.7: And I meditated in the night with my own heart: and I was exercised, and I swept my spirit.
75.8: Will God then cast off for ever? or will he never be more favourable again?
75.9: Or will he cut off his mercy for ever, from generation to generation?
75.10: Or will God forget to shew mercy? or will he in his anger shut up his mercies?
75.11: And I said, Now have I begun: this is the change of the right hand of the Most High.
75.12: I remembered the works of the Lord: for I will be mindful of thy wonders from the beginning.
75.13: And I will meditate on all thy works: and will be employed in thy inventions.
75.14: Thy way, O God, is in the holy place: who is the great God, like our God?  Thou art the God that dost wonders.
75.15: Thou hast made thy power known among the nations:  with thy arm thou hast redeemed thy people, the children of Jacob, and of Joseph.
75.16: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee: and they were afraid, and the depths were troubled.
75.17: Great was the noise of the waters: the clouds sent out a sound.
75.18: For thy arrows pass:  the voice of thy thunder in a wheel.
75.19: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in many waters: and thy footsteps shall not be known.
75.20: *Thou hast conducted thy people like sheep, by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

76.2: I will open my mouth in parables: I will utter propositions from the beginning.
76.3: How great things have we heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
76.4: They have not been hidden from their children, in another generation.
76.5: And he set up a testimony in Jacob; and made a law in Israel.
76.6: How great things he commanded our fathers, that they should make the same known to their children:  that another generation might know them.
76.7: That they may put their hope in God, and may not forget the works of God: and may seek his commandments.
76.8: That they may not become like their fathers, a perverse and exasperating generation.
76.9: The sons of Ephraim, who bend and shoot with the bow: they have turned back in the day of battle.
76.10: They kept not the covenant of God: and in his law they would not walk.
76.11: And they forgot his benefits, and his wonders that he hath shewn them.
76.12: Wonderful things did he do in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Taneos.
76.13: *He divided the sea and brought them through: and he made the waters to stand as in a vessel.
76.14: And he conducted them with a cloud by day: and all the night with a light of fire
76.15: *He struck the rock in the wilderness: and gave them to drink, as out of the great deep.
76.16: He brought forth water out of the rock: and made streams run down as rivers.
76.17: And they added yet more sin against him: they provoked the most High to wrath in the place without water.
76.18: And they tempted God in their hearts, by asking meat for their desires.
76.19: And they spoke ill of God: they said: Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
76.20: Because he struck the rock, and the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed, Can he also give bread, or provide a table for his people?
76.21: *Therefore, the Lord heard, and was angry: and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and wrath came up against Israel.
76.22: Because they believed not in God: and trusted not in his salvation.
76.23: And he had commanded the clouds from above, and had opened the doors of heaven.
76.24: *And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them the bread of heaven.
76.25: *Man eat the bread of angels: he sent them provisions in abundance.
76.26: *He removed the south wind from heaven: and by his power brought in the south-west wind.
76.27: And he rained upon them flesh as dust: and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.
76.28: And they fell in the midst of their camp, round about their pavilions.
76.29: So they did eat, and were filled exceedingly, and he gave them their desire:  they were not defrauded of that which they craved.
76.30: *As yet their meat was in their mouth:  and the wrath of God came upon them.
76.31: In all these things they sinned still: and they believed not for his wondrous works.
76.32: And their days were consumed in vanity, and their years in haste.
76.33: When he slew them, then they sought him; and they returned, and came to him early in the morning.
76.34: And they remembered that God was their helper: and the most high God their Redeemer.
76.35: And they loved him with their mouth: and with their tongue they lied unto him:
76.36: But their heart was not right with him: nor were they counted faithful in his covenant.
76.37: But he is merciful, and will forgive their sins: and will not destroy them.
76.38: And he remembered that they are flesh: a wind that goeth and returneth not.
76.39: How often did they provoke him in the desert: and move him to wrath in the place without water?
76.40: And they turned back and tempted God: and grieved the holy one of Israel.
76.41: They remembered not his hand, in the day that he redeemed them from the hand of him that afflicted them:
76.42: How he wrought his signs in Egypt: and his wonders in the field of Taneos.
76.43: *And he turned their rivers into blood, and their showers that they might not drink.
76.44: *He sent amongst them divers sorts of flies, which devoured them: *and frogs, which destroyed them.
76.45: *And he gave up their fruits to the blast, and their labours to the locust.
76.46: *And he destroyed their vineyards with hail, and their mulberry trees with hoar-frost.
76.47: And he gave up their cattle to the hail, and their stock to the fire.
76.48: And he sent upon them the wrath of his indignation: indignation, and wrath, and trouble, which he sent by evil angels.
76.49: He made a way for a path to his anger: he spared not their souls from death, and their cattle he shut up in death.
76.50: *And he killed all the first-born in the land of Egypt: the first-fruits of all their labour in the tabernacles of Cham.
76.51: And he took away his own people as sheep: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
76.52: And he brought them out in hope, and they feared not: *and the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
76.53: And he brought them into the mountain of his sanctuary: the mountain which his right hand had purchased.
76.54: And he made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.
76.55: Yet they tempted, and provoked the most high God: and they kept not his testimonies.
76.56: And they turned away, and kept not the covenant: even like their fathers, they were turned aside as a crooked bow.
76.57: They provoked him to anger on their hills: and moved him to jealousy with their graven things.
76.58: God heard, and despised them, and he reduced Israel exceedingly, as it were to nothing.
76.59: *And he put away the tabernacle of Silo, his tabernacle, where he dwelt among men.
76.60: And he delivered their strength into captivity: and their beauty into the hands of the enemy.
76.61: And he shut up his people under the sword: and he despised his inheritance.
76.62: Fire consumed their young men: and their maidens were not lamented.
76.63: Their priests fell by the sword: and their widows did not mourn.
76.64: And the Lord was awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that hath been surfeited with wine.
76.65: And he smote his enemies on the hinder parts: he put them to an everlasting reproach.
76.66: And he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
76.67: But he chose the tribe of Juda, Mount Sion which he loved.
76.68: And he built his sanctuary as of unicorns, in the land which he founded for ever.
76.69: And he chose his servant, David, and took him from the flocks of sheep: he brought him from following the ewes great with young,
76.70: To feed Jacob, his servant, and Israel, his inheritance.
76.71: And he fed them in the innocence of his heart: and conducted them by the skilfulness of his hands.

77.2: They have given the dead bodies of thy servants to be meat for the fowls of the air: the flesh of thy saints for the beasts of the earth.
77.3: They have poured out their blood as water, round about Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
77.4: We are become a reproach to our neighbours; a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.
77.5: How long, O Lord, wilt thou be angry for ever: shall thy zeal be kindled like a fire?
77.6: *Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that have not known thee: and upon the kingdoms, that have not called upon thy name.
77.7: Because they have devoured Jacob; and have laid waste his place.
77.8: *Remember not our former iniquities: let thy mercies speedily prevent us, for we are become exceedingly poor.
77.9: Help us, O God, our Saviour: and for the glory of thy name, O Lord, deliver us: and forgive us our sins for thy name's sake:
77.10: Lest they should say among the Gentiles: Where is their God? And let him be made known among the nations before our eyes,
77.11: By the revenging the blood of thy servants, which hath been shed:  let the sighing of the prisoners come in before thee.
77.12: And render to our neighbours seven-fold in their bosom: the reproach wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.
77.13: But we thy people, and the sheep of thy pasture, will give thanks to thee for ever.

78.1: Unto the end, for them that shall he changed, a testimony for Asaph, a psalm.
78.2: Give ear, O thou that rulest Israel: thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep.
78.3: Thou that sittest upon the Cherubim, shine forth  before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses.
78.4: Convert us, O God: and shew us thy face, and we shall be saved.
78.5: O Lord, God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy servant?
78.6: How long wilt thou feed us with the bread of tears: and give us for our drink tears in measure?
78.7: Thou hast made us to be a contradiction to our neighbours: and our enemies have scoffed at us.
78.8: O God of hosts, convert us: and shew thy face, and we shall be saved.
78.9: Thou hast brought a vineyard out of Egypt: thou hast cast cut the Gentiles and planted it.
78.10: Thou wast the guide of its journey in its sight: thou plantedst the roots thereof, and it filled the land.
78.11: The shadow of it covered the hills: and the branches thereof the cedars of God.
78.12: It stretched forth its branches unto the sea, and its boughs unto the river.
78.13: Why hast thou broken down the hedge thereof, so that all they who pass by the way, do pluck it?
78.14: The boar out of the wood hath laid it waste: and a singular wild beast hath devoured it.
78.15: Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vineyard:
78.16: And perfect the same which thy right hand hath planted: and upon the Son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself.
78.17: Things set on fire and dug down, shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
78.18: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand: and upon the Son of man, whom thou hast confirmed for thyself.
78.19: And we depart not from thee, thou shalt quicken us: and we will call upon thy name.
78.20: O Lord God of hosts, convert us: and shew thy face, and we shall be saved.

79.1: Unto the end, for the wine-presses, a psalm for Asaph himself.
79.2: Rejoice to God our helper: sing aloud to the God of Jacob.
79.3: Take a psalm and bring hither the timbrel: the pleasant psaltery with the harp.
79.4: Blow up the trumpet on the new moon, on the noted day of your solemnity.
79.5: For it is a commandment in Israel, and a judgment to the God of Jacob.
79.6: *He ordained it for a testimony in Joseph, when he came out of the land of Egypt: he heard a tongue which he knew not.
79.7: He removed his back from the burdens: his hands had served in baskets.
79.8: Thou calledst upon me in affliction, and I delivered thee: I heard thee in the secret place of tempest: *I proved thee at the waters of contradiction.
79.9: Hear, O my people, and I will testify to thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken to me,  there shall be *no new god in thee: neither shalt thou adore a strange god.
79.10: For I am the Lord, thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
79.11: But my people heard not my voice: and Israel hearkened not to me.
79.12: *So I let them go according to the desires of their heart: they shall walk in their own inventions.
79.13: *If my people had heard me: if Israel had walked in my ways:
79.14: I should soon have humbled their enemies, and laid my hand on them that troubled them.
79.15: The enemies of the Lord have lied to him: and their time shall be for ever.
79.16: And he fed them with the fat of wheat, and filled them with the honey out of the rock.

80.2: How long will you judge unjustly: and accept the persons of the wicked?
80.3: Judge for the needy and fatherless: do justice to the humble and the poor.
80.4: *Rescue the poor; and deliver the needy out of the hand of the sinner.
80.5: They have not known nor understood; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth shall be moved.
80.6: *I have said: You are gods, and all of you the sons of the most High.
80.7: But you like men shall die: and shall fall like one of the princes.
80.8: Arise, O God, judge thou the earth: for thou shalt inherit among all the nations.

81.1: A canticle of a psalm for Asaph.
81.2: O God, who shall be like to thee? hold not thy peace, neither be thou still, O God;
81.3: For lo thy enemies have made a noise: and they that hate thee, have lifted up the head.
81.4: They have taken a malicious counsel against thy people, and have consulted against thy saints.
81.5: They have said: Come and let us destroy them, so that they be not a nation: and let the name of Israel be remembered no more.
81.6: For they have contrived with one consent: they have made a covenant together against thee,  the tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ismahelites:
81.7: Moab, and the Agarenes,  Gebal, and Ammon and Amalec: the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre.
81.8: Yea, and the Assyrian also is joined with them: they are come to the aid of the sons of Lot.
81.9: Do to them *as thou didst to Madian **and to Sisara: as to Jaban at the brook of Cisson.
81.10: Who perished at Endor: and became as dung for the earth.
81.11: *Make their princes like Oreb, **and Zeb, and Zebee, and Salmana.
81.12: All their princes,  who have said: Let us possess the sanctuary of God for an inheritance.
81.13: O my God, make them like a wheel; and as stubble before the wind.
81.14: As fire which burneth the wood: and as a flame burning mountains.
81.15: So shalt thou pursue them with thy tempest: and shalt trouble them in thy wrath.
81.16: Fill their faces with shame; and they shall seek thy name, O Lord.
81.17: Let them be ashamed and troubled for ever and ever: and let them be confounded and perish.
81.18: And let them know that the Lord is thy name: thou alone art the most High over all the earth.

82.1: Unto the end, for the wine-presses, a psalm for the sons of Core.
82.2: How lovely are thy tabernacles, O Lord of host!  my soul longeth and fainteth for the courts of the Lord.
82.3: For the sparrow hath found herself a house, and the turtle a nest for herself, where she may lay her young ones:
82.4: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house, O Lord: they shall praise thee for ever and ever.
82.5: Blessed is the man whose help is from thee: in his heart he hath disposed to ascend by steps,  in the vale of tears, in the place which he hath set.
82.6: For the lawgiver shall give a blessing, they shall go from virtue to virtue: the God of gods shall be seen in Sion.
82.7: O Lord, God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob.
82.8: Behold, O God, our protector: and look on the face of thy Christ.
82.9: For better is one day in thy courts above thousands.
82.10: For God loveth mercy and truth: the Lord will give grace and glory.
82.11: He will not deprive of good things them that walk in innocence: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

83.1: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, a psalm.
83.2: Lord, thou hast blessed thy land: thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.
83.3: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people: thou hast covered all their sins.
83.4: Thou hast mitigated all thy anger: thou hast turned away from the wrath of thy indignation.
83.5: Convert us, O God our Saviour: and turn off thy anger from us.
83.6: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever: or wilt thou extend thy wrath from generation to generation?
83.7: Thou wilt turn, O God, and bring us to life: and thy people shall rejoice in thee.
83.8: Shew us, O Lord, thy mercy; and grant us thy salvation.
83.9: I will hear what the Lord God will speak in me: for he will speak peace unto his people:
83.10: Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him: that glory may dwell in our land.
83.11: Mercy and truth have met each other: justice and peace have kissed.
83.12: Truth is sprung out of the earth: and justice hath looked down from heaven.
83.13: For the Lord will give goodness: and our earth shall yield her fruit.
83.14: Justice shall walk before him: and shall set his steps in the way.

84.2: Preserve my soul, for I am holy: save thy servant, O my God, that trusteth in thee.
84.3: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I have cried to thee all the day.  Give joy to the soul of thy servant; for to thee, O Lord, I have lifted up my soul.
84.4: *For thou, O Lord, art sweet and mild: and plenteous in mercy to all that call upon thee.
84.5: Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer: and attend to the voice of my petition.
84.6: I have called upon thee in the day of my trouble: because thou hast heard me.
84.7: There is none among the gods like unto thee, O Lord; and there is none according to thy works.
84.8: All the nations thou hast made shall come and adore before thee, O Lord: and they shall glorify thy name.
84.9: For thou art great and dost wonderful things: thou art God alone.
84.10: Conduct me, O Lord, in thy way, and I will walk in thy truth: let my heart rejoice, that it may fear thy name.
84.11: I will praise thee, O Lord, my God, with my whole heart, and I will glorify thy name for ever:
84.12: For thy mercy is great towards me: and thou hast delivered my soul out of the lower hell.
84.13: O God, the wicked are risen up against me, and the assembly of the mighty have sought my soul: and they have not set thee before their eyes.
84.14: And thou, O Lord, art a God of compassion, and merciful, patient, and of much mercy, and true.
84.15: O look upon me, and have mercy on me: give thy command to thy servant, and save the son of thy handmaid.
84.16: Shew me a token for good: that they who hate me may see, and be confounded, because thou, O Lord, hast helped me and hast comforted me.

85.1: For the sons of Core, a psalm of a canticle.
85.2: The Lord loveth the gates of Sion above all the tabernacles of Jacob.
85.3: Glorious things are said of thee, O city of God.
85.4: I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me.
85.5: Shall not Sion say: This man and that man is born in her? and the Highest himself hath founded her.
85.6: The Lord shall tell in his writings of peoples and of princes, of them that have been in her.
85.7: The dwelling in thee is as it were of all rejoicing.

86.1: A canticle of a psalm for the sons of Core: unto the end, for Maheleth, to answer, understanding of Eman, the Ezrahite.
86.2: O Lord, the God of my salvation: I have cried in the day, and in the night before thee.
86.3: Let my prayer come in before thee: incline thy ear to my petition.
86.4: For my soul is filled with evils: and my life hath drawn nigh to hell.
86.5: I am counted among them that go down to the pit: I am become as a man without help,  free among the dead.
86.6: They have laid me in the lower pit: in the dark places, and in the shadow of death.
86.7: Thy wrath is strong over me: and all thy waves thou hast brought in upon me.
86.8: Thou hast put away my acquaintance far from me: they have set me an abomination to themselves.
86.9: I was delivered up, and came not forth:  my eyes languished through poverty.
86.10: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? or shall physicians raise to life, and give praise to thee?
86.11: Shall any one in the sepulchre declare thy mercy: and thy truth in destruction?
86.12: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark; and thy justice in the land of forgetfulness?
86.13: But I, O Lord, have cried to thee: and in the morning my prayer shall prevent thee.
86.14: Lord, why castest thou off my prayer: why turnest thou away thy face from me?
86.15: I am poor, and in labours from my youth: and being exalted, have been humbled and troubled.
86.16: Thy wrath hath come upon me: and thy terrors have troubled me.
86.17: They have come round about me like water all the day: they have compassed me about together.
86.18: Friend and neighbour thou hast put far from me: and my acquaintance, because of misery.

87.1: Of understanding, for Ethan, the Ezrahite.
87.2: The mercies of the Lord I will sing for ever.
87.3: For thou hast said: Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens: thy truth shall be prepared in them.
87.4: I have made a covenant with my elect: *I have sworn to David my servant:  Thy seed will I settle for ever.
87.5: The heavens shall confess thy wonders, O Lord: and thy truth in the church of the saints.
87.6: For who in the clouds can be compared to the Lord: or who among the sons of God shall be like to God?
87.7: God, who is glorified in the assembly of the saints: great and terrible above all them that are about him.
87.8: O Lord God of hosts, who is like to thee? thou art mighty, O Lord, and thy truth is round about thee.
87.9: Thou rulest the power of the sea: and appeasest the motion of the waves thereof.
87.10: Thou hast humbled the proud one, as one that is slain: with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies.
87.11: *Thine are the heavens, and thine is the earth: the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded:  the north and the sea thou hast created.
87.12: Thabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name:  thy arm is with might.
87.13: Let thy hand be strengthened, and thy right hand exalted:  justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne.
87.14: Mercy and truth shall go before thy face:  blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation.
87.15: They shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance:  and in thy name they shall rejoice all the day, and in thy justice they shall be exalted.
87.16: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted.
87.17: For our protection is of the Lord, and of our king the holy one of Israel.
87.18: Then thou spokest in a vision to thy saints, and saidst: I have laid help upon one that is mighty, and have exalted one chosen out of my people.
87.19: *I have found David, my servant: with my holy oil I have anointed him.
87.20: For my hand shall help him: and my arm shall strengthen him.
87.21: The enemy shall have no advantage over him: nor the son of iniquity have power to hurt him.
87.22: And I will cut down his enemies before his face; and them that hate him I will put to flight.
87.23: And my truth and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
87.24: And I will set his hand in the sea; and his right hand in the rivers.
87.25: He shall cry out to me: Thou art my father: my God, and the support of my salvation.
87.26: And I will make him my first-born, high above the kings of the earth.
87.27: I will keep my mercy for him for ever: and my covenant faithful to him.
87.28: And I will make his seed to endure for evermore: and his throne as the days of heaven.
87.29: And if his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments:
87.30: If they profane my justices; and keep not my commandments:
87.31: I will visit their iniquities with a rod: and their sins with stripes.
87.32: But my mercy I will not take away from him: nor will I suffer my truth to fail.
87.33: Neither will I profane my covenant: and the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void.
87.34: Once have I sworn by my holiness: I will not lie unto David:  his seed shall endure for ever.
87.35: *And his throne as the sun before me: and as the moon perfect for ever, and a faithful witness in heaven.
87.36: But thou hast rejected and despised: thou hast been angry with thy anointed.
87.37: Thou hast overthrown the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his sanctuary on the earth.
87.38: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast made his strength fear.
87.39: All that pass by the way have robbed him: he is become a reproach to his neighbours.
87.40: Thou hast set up the right hand of them that oppress him: thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
87.41: Thou hast turned away the help of his sword: and hast not assisted him in battle.
87.42: Thou hast made his purification to cease: and thou hast cast his throne down to the ground.
87.43: Thou hast shortened the days of his time: thou hast covered him with confusion.
87.44: How long, O Lord, turnest thou away unto the end? shall thy anger burn like fire?
87.45: Remember what my substance is: for hast thou made all the children of men in vain?
87.46: Who is the man that shall live, and not see death: that shall deliver his soul from the hand of hell?
87.47: Lord, where are thy ancient mercies, according to *what thou didst swear to David in thy truth?
87.48: Be mindful, O Lord, of the reproach of thy servants (which I have held in my bosom) of many nations:
87.49: Wherewith thy enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the change of thy anointed.
87.50: Blessed be the Lord for evermore. So be it, so be it.

88.1: A prayer of Moses, the man of God.
88.2: Before the mountains were made, or the earth and the world was formed; from eternity and to eternity thou art God.
88.3: Turn not man away to be brought low: and thou hast said: Be converted, O ye sons of men.
88.4: For a thousand years in thy sight are as yesterday, which is past.
88.5: And as a watch in the night,  things that are counted nothing, shall their years be.
88.6: In the morning man shall grow up like grass, in the morning he shall flourish and pass away: in the evening he shall fall, grow dry and wither.
88.7: For in thy wrath we have fainted away: and are troubled in thy indignation.
88.8: Thou hast set our iniquities before thy eyes: our life in the light of thy countenance.
88.9: For all our days are spent; and in thy wrath we have fainted away.
88.10: Our years shall be considered as a spider:  *the days of our years in them are threescore and ten years.
88.11: Who knoweth the power of thy anger, and for thy fear  can number thy wrath?
88.12: Return, O Lord, how long? and be intreated in favour of thy servants.
88.13: We are filled in the morning with thy mercy: and we have rejoiced, and are delighted all our days.
88.14: We have rejoiced for the days in which thou hast humbled us: for the years in which we have seen evils.
88.15: Look upon thy servants and upon their works: and direct their children.
88.16: And let the brightness of the Lord, our God, be upon us: and direct thou the works of our hands over us; yea, the work of our hands do thou direct.

89.1: The praise of a canticle for David.
89.2: He shall say to the Lord: Thou art my protector and my refuge: my God, in him will I trust.
89.3: For he hath delivered me from the snare of the hunters: and from the sharp word.
89.4: He will overshadow thee with his shoulders: and under his wings thou shalt trust.
89.5: His truth shall compass thee with a shield: thou shalt not be afraid of the terror of the night.
89.6: Of the arrow that flieth in the day, of the business that walketh about in the dark: of invasion, or of the noon-day devil.
89.7: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand: but it shall not come nigh to thee.
89.8: But thou shalt consider with thy eyes: and shalt see the reward of the wicked.
89.9: Because thou, O Lord, art my hope: thou hast made the Most High thy refuge.
89.10: There shall no evil come to thee: nor shall the scourge come near thy dwelling.
89.11: *For he hath given his angels charge over thee: to keep thee in all thy ways.
89.12: In their hands they shall bear thee up: lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
89.13: Thou shalt walk upon the asp and the basilisk: and thou shalt trample under foot the lion and the dragon.
89.14: Because he hath hoped in me, I will deliver him: I will protect him, because he hath known my name.
89.15: He shall cry to me, and I will hear him: I am with him in tribulation, I will deliver him, and I will glorify him.
89.16: I will fill him with length of days; and I will shew him my salvation.

90.1: A psalm of a canticle on the sabbath-day.
90.2: It is good to give praise to the Lord: and to sing to thy name, O Most High.
90.3: To shew forth thy mercy in the morning, and thy truth in the night:
90.4: Upon an instrument of ten strings, upon the psaltery: with a canticle, upon the harp.
90.5: For thou hast given me, O Lord, a delight in thy doings: and in the works of thy hands I shall rejoice.
90.6: O Lord, how great are thy works! thy thoughts are exceedingly deep.
90.7: The senseless man shall not know: nor will the fool understand these things.
90.8: When the wicked shall spring up as grass: and all the workers of iniquity shall appear:
90.9: That they may perish for ever and ever:  but thou, O Lord, art Most High for evermore.
90.10: For behold thy enemies, O Lord, for behold thy enemies shall perish: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
90.11: But my horn shall be exalted like that of the unicorn: and my old age in plentiful mercy.
90.12: My eye also hath looked down upon my enemies: and my ear shall hear of the downfall of the malignant that rise up against me.
90.13: The just shall flourish like the palm-tree: he shall grow up like the cedar of Libanus.
90.14: They that are planted in the house of the Lord, shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.
90.15: They shall still increase in a fruitful old age: and shall be well treated,  that they may shew,

91.1: The Lord hath reigned, he is clothed with beauty: the Lord is clothed with strength, and hath girded himself.
91.2: Thy throne is prepared from of old: thou art from everlasting.
91.3: The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice.
91.4: The floods have lifted up their waves,  with the noise of many waters.
91.5: Thy testimonies are become exceedingly credible: holiness becometh thy house, O Lord, unto length of days.

92.1: The Lord is the God, to whom revenge belongeth: the God of revenge hath acted freely.
92.2: Lift up thyself, thou that judgest the earth, render a reward to the proud.
92.3: How long shall sinners, O Lord, how long shall sinners glory?
92.4: Shall they utter, and speak iniquity: shall all speak who work injustice?
92.5: Thy people, O Lord, they have brought low: and they have afflicted thy inheritance.
92.6: They have slain the widow and the stranger: and they have murdered the fatherless.
92.7: And they have said: The Lord shall not see: neither shall the God of Jacob understand.
92.8: Understand, ye senseless among the people: and you fools, be wise at last.
92.9: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? or he that formed the eye, doth he not consider?
92.10: He that chastiseth nations, shall he not rebuke: he that teacheth man knowledge?
92.11: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of men, that they are vain.
92.12: Blessed is the man whom thou shalt instruct, O Lord: and shalt teach him out of thy law.
92.13: That thou mayst give him rest from the evil days: till a pit be dug for the wicked.
92.14: For the Lord will not cast off his people: neither will he forsake his own inheritance.
92.15: Until justice be turned into judgment: and they that are near it, are all the upright in heart.
92.16: Who shall rise up for me against the evil doers? or who shall stand with me against the workers of iniquity?
92.17: Unless the Lord had been my helper: my soul had almost dwelt in hell.
92.18: If I said: My foot is moved: thy mercy, O Lord, assisted me.
92.19: According to the multitude of my sorrows in my heart, thy comforts have given joy to my soul.
92.20: Doth the seat of iniquity stick to thee, who framest labour in commandment?
92.21: They will hunt after the soul of the just, and will condemn innocent blood.
92.22: But the Lord is my refuge: and my God the help of my hope.
92.23: And he will render them their iniquity: and in their malice he will destroy them: the Lord, our God, will destroy them.

93.1: Come, let us praise the Lord with joy: let us joyfully sing to God our Saviour.
93.2: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving: and make a joyful noise to him with psalms.
93.3: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.
93.4: For in his hand are all the ends of the earth: and the heights of the mountains are his.
93.5: For the sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.
93.6: Come, let us adore and fall down: and weep before the Lord that made us.
93.7: For he is the Lord, our God: and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand.
93.8: *To-day if you shall hear his voice, harden not your hearts:
93.9: As in the provocation, according to the day of temptation in the wilderness: where your fathers tempted me, they proved me, and saw my works.
93.10: *Forty years long was I offended with that generation, and I said: These always err in heart.
93.11: And these men have not known my ways: *so I swore in my wrath that they shall not enter into my rest.

94.1: A canticle for David himself, when the house was built after the captivity.
94.2: Sing ye to the Lord and bless his name: shew forth his salvation from day to day.
94.3: Declare his glory among the Gentiles: his wonders among all people.
94.4: For the Lord is great, and exceedingly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.
94.5: For all the gods of the Gentiles are devils: but the Lord made the heavens.
94.6: Praise and beauty are before him: holiness and majesty in his sanctuary.
94.7: Bring ye to the Lord, O ye kindreds of the Gentiles, bring ye to the Lord glory and honour:  bring to the Lord glory unto his name.
94.8: Bring up sacrifices, and come unto his courts:  adore ye the Lord in his holy court.
94.9: Let all the earth be moved at his presence.  Say ye among the Gentiles, the Lord hath reigned.
94.10: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad, let the sea be moved, and the fulness thereof:  the fields and all things that are in them shall be joyful.
94.11: Then shall all the trees of the woods rejoice  before the face of the Lord, because he cometh: because he cometh to judge the earth.

95.1: For the same David, when his land was restored again to him.
95.2: Clouds and darkness are round about him: justice and judgment are the establishment of his throne.
95.3: A fire shall go before him, and shall burn his enemies round about.
95.4: His lightnings have shone forth to the world: the earth saw and trembled.
95.5: The mountains melted like wax, at the presence of the Lord: at the presence of the Lord all the earth.
95.6: The heavens declared his justice: and all people saw his glory.
95.7: *Let them be all confounded that adore graven things, and that glory in their idols.
95.8: **Adore him, all you his angels:  Sion heard, and was glad.
95.9: For thou art the most high Lord over all the earth: thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods.
95.10: *You that love the Lord, hate evil: the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints, he will deliver them out of the hand of the sinner.
95.11: Light is risen to the just, and joy to the right of heart.
95.12: Rejoice, ye just, in the Lord: and give praise to the remembrance of his holiness.

96.2: *The Lord hath made known his salvation: he hath revealed his justice in the sight of the Gentiles.
96.3: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel.
96.4: Sing joyfully to God, all the earth: make melody, rejoice and sing.
96.5: Sing praise to the Lord on the harp, on the harp, and with the voice of a psalm:  with long trumpets, and sound of cornet.
96.6: Make a joyful noise before the Lord our king:  let the sea be moved and the fulness thereof: the world and them that dwell therein.
96.7: The rivers shall clap their hands, the mountains shall rejoice together  at the presence of the Lord: because he cometh to judge the earth.

97.2: The Lord is great in Sion, and high above all people.
97.3: Let them give praise to thy great name: for it is terrible and holy:  and the king's honour loveth judgment.
97.4: Exalt ye the Lord, our God, and adore his footstool: for it is holy.
97.5: Moses and Aaron among his priests: and Samuel among them that call upon his name.
97.6: They called upon the Lord, and he heard them:  he spoke to them in the pillar of the cloud.
97.7: Thou didst hear them, O Lord, our God: thou wast a merciful God to them, and taking vengeance on all their inventions.
97.8: Exalt ye the Lord, our God, and adore at his holy mountain: for the Lord, our God, is holy.

98.2: Sing joyfully to God, all the earth: serve ye the Lord with gladness.
98.3: Know ye that the Lord, he is God: he made us, and not we ourselves.
98.4: We are his people and the sheep of his pasture.  Go ye into his gates with praise, into his courts with hymns: and give glory to him.
98.5: Praise ye his name:  for the Lord is sweet, his mercy endureth for ever, and his truth to generation and generation.

99.2: Mercy and judgment I will sing to thee, O Lord: I will sing,  and I will understand in the unspotted way, when thou shalt come to me.
99.3: I did not set before my eyes any unjust thing: I hated the workers of iniquities.
99.4: The perverse heart did not cleave to me: and the malignant, that turned aside from me, I would not know.
99.5: The man that in private detracted his neighbour, him did I persecute.
99.6: My eyes were upon the faithful of the earth, to sit with me: the man that walked in the perfect way, he served me.
99.7: He that worketh pride shall not dwell in the midst of my house: he that speaketh unjust things did not prosper before my eyes.
99.8: In the morning I put to death all the wicked of the land: that I might cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the Lord.

100.1: The prayer of the poor man, when he was anxious, and poured out his supplication before the Lord.
100.2: Hear, O Lord, my prayer: and let my cry come to thee.
100.3: Turn not away thy face from me: in the day when I am in trouble, incline thy ear to me.
100.4: For my days are vanished like smoke: and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire.
100.5: I am smitten as grass, and my heart is withered: because I forgot to eat my bread.
100.6: Through the voice of my groaning, my bone hath cleaved to my flesh.
100.7: I am become like to a pelican of the wilderness: I am like a night-raven in the house.
100.8: I have watched, and am become as a sparrow, all alone on the housetop.
100.9: All the day long my enemies reproached me: and they that praised me, did swear against me.
100.10: For I did eat ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping.
100.11: Because of thy anger and indignation: for having lifted me up, thou hast thrown me down.
100.12: My days have declined like a shadow, and I am withered like grass.
100.13: But thou, O Lord, endurest for ever: and thy memorial to all generations.
100.14: Thou shalt arise and have mercy on Sion: for it is time to have mercy on it, for the time is come.
100.15: For the stones thereof have pleased thy servants: and they shall have pity on the earth thereof.
100.16: And the Gentiles shall fear thy name, O Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
100.17: For the Lord hath built up Sion: and he shall be seen in his glory.
100.18: He hath had regard to the prayer of the humble: and he hath not despised their petition.
100.19: Let these things be written unto another generation: and the people that shall be created, shall praise the Lord:
100.20: Because he hath looked forth from his high sanctuary: from heaven the Lord hath looked upon the earth.
100.21: That he might hear the groans of them that are in fetters: that he might release the children of the slain:
100.22: That they may declare the name of the Lord in Sion: and his praise in Jerusalem.
100.23: When the people assemble together, and kings, to serve the Lord.
100.24: He answered him in the way of his strength: Declare unto me the fewness of my days.
100.25: Call me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are unto generation and generation.
100.26: In the beginning, O Lord, thou foundedst the earth: and the heavens are the works of thy hands.
100.27: They shall perish, but thou remainest: and all of them shall grow old like a garment:
100.28: And as a vesture thou shalt change them, and they shall be changed.  But thou art always the self-same, and thy years shall not fail.
100.29: The children of thy servants shall continue: and their seed shall be directed for ever.

101.2: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and never forget all he hath done for thee.
101.3: Who forgiveth all thy iniquities: who healeth all thy diseases.
101.4: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction: who crowneth thee with mercy and compassion.
101.5: Who satisfieth thy desire with good things: thy youth shall be renewed like the eagle's.
101.6: The Lord doth mercies, and judgment for all that suffer wrong.
101.7: He hath made his ways known to Moses: his wills to the children of Israel.
101.8: *The Lord is compassionate and merciful: long-suffering and plenteous in mercy.
101.9: He will not always be angry: nor will he threaten for ever.
101.10: He hath not dealt with us according to our sins: nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
101.11: For according to the height of the heaven above the earth: he hath strengthened his mercy towards them that fear him.
101.12: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our iniquities from us.
101.13: As a father hath compassion on his children, so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him:  for he knoweth our frame.
101.14: He remembereth that we are dust:  man's days are as grass, as the flower of the field so shall he flourish.
101.15: For the spirit shall pass in him, and he shall not be: and he shall know his place no more.
101.16: But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity and unto eternity upon them that fear him:
101.17: And his justice unto children's children,  to such as keep his covenant,
101.18: The Lord hath prepared his throne in heaven: and his kingdom shall rule over all.
101.19: Bless the Lord, all ye his angels: you that are mighty in strength, and execute his word, hearkening to the voice of his orders.
101.20: Bless the Lord, all ye his hosts: you ministers of his that do his will.
101.21: Bless the Lord, all his works: in every place of his dominion, O my soul, bless thou the Lord.

102.2: Thou hast put on praise and beauty:  and art clothed with light as with a garment.
102.3: Who stretchest out the heaven like a pavilion:  who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water.
102.4: *Who makest thy angels spirits: and thy ministers a burning fire.
102.5: Who hast founded the earth upon its own bases: it shall not be moved for ever and ever.
102.6: The deep, like a garment, is its clothing: above the mountains shall the waters stand.
102.7: At thy rebuke they shall flee: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear.
102.8: The mountains ascend, and the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them.
102.9: Thou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over: neither shall they return to cover the earth.
102.10: Thou sendest forth springs in the vales: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass.
102.11: All the beasts of the field shall drink: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst.
102.12: Over them the birds of the air shall dwell: from the midst of the rocks they shall give forth their voices.
102.13: Thou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works:
102.14: Bringing forth grass for cattle, and herb for the service of men.
102.15: That thou mayst bring bread out of the earth:  and that wine may cheer the heart of man.
102.16: The trees of the field shall be filled, and the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted:  there the sparrows shall make their nests.
102.17: The highest of them is the house of the heron.  The high hills are a refuge for the harts, the rock for the irchins.
102.18: He hath made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.
102.19: Thou hast appointed darkness, and it is night: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about.
102.20: The young lions roaring after their prey, and seeking their meat from God.
102.21: The sun ariseth, and they are gathered together: and they shall lie down in their dens.
102.22: Man shall go forth to his work, and to his labour until the evening.
102.23: How great are thy works, O Lord! thou hast made all things in wisdom; the earth is filled with thy riches.
102.24: So is this great sea, which stretcheth wide its arms: there are creeping things without number.
102.25: Creatures little and great.  There the ships shall go.
102.26: This sea-dragon which thou hast formed to play therein.  All expect of thee that thou give them food in season.
102.27: What thou givest to them they shall gather up: when thou openest thy hand, they shall all be filled with good.
102.28: But if thou turnest away thy face, they shall be troubled: thou shalt take away their breath, and they shall fail, and shall return to their dust.
102.29: Thou shalt send forth thy spirit, and they shall be created: and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.
102.30: May the glory of the Lord endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.
102.31: He looketh upon the earth, and maketh it tremble: he toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
102.32: *I will sing to the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
102.33: Let my speech be acceptable to him: but I will take delight in the Lord.
102.34: Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, and the unjust, so that they be no more: O my soul, bless thou the Lord.

103.2: Sing to him, yea sing praises to him: relate all his wondrous works.
103.3: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.
103.4: Seek ye the Lord, and be strengthened: seek his face evermore.
103.5: Remember his marvellous works, which he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth.
103.6: O ye seed of Abraham his servant; ye sons of Jacob, his chosen.
103.7: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.
103.8: He hath remembered his covenant for ever: the word which he commanded to a thousand generations:
103.9: *Which he made to Abraham; and his oath to Isaac:
103.10: And he appointed the same to Jacob for a law: and to Israel, for an everlasting testament:
103.11: Saying: To thee will I give the land of Chanaan, the lot of your inheritance.
103.12: When they were but a small number: yea very few, and sojourners therein:
103.13: And they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people.
103.14: He suffered no man to hurt them: and he reproved kings for their sakes.
103.15: *Touch ye not my anointed: and do no evil to my prophets.
103.16: And he called a famine upon the land: and he broke in pieces all the support of bread.
103.17: He sent a man before them: *Joseph, who was sold for a slave.
103.18: *They humbled his feet in fetters: the iron pierced his soul,  until his word came.
103.19: The word of the Lord inflamed him.  *The king sent, and he released him: the ruler of the people, and he set him at liberty.
103.20: He made him master of his house, and ruler of all his possession.
103.21: That he might instruct his princes as himself, and teach his ancients wisdom.
103.22: *And Israel went into Egypt: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham.
103.23: *And he increased his people exceedingly: and strengthened them over their enemies.
103.24: He turned their heart to hate his people: and to deal deceitfully with his servants.
103.25: *He sent Moses, his servant: Aaron, the man whom he had chosen.
103.26: *He gave them power to shew his signs, and his wonders in the land of Cham.
103.27: *He sent darkness, and made it obscure: and grieved not his words.
103.28: *He turned their waters into blood, and destroyed their fish.
103.29: *Their land brought forth frogs, in the inner chambers of their kings.
103.30: *He spoke, and there came divers sorts of flies and cinifes in all their coasts.
103.31: He gave them hail for rain, a burning fire in the land.
103.32: And he destroyed their vineyards and their fig-trees: and he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts.
103.33: *He spoke, and the locust came, and the bruchus, of which there was no number:
103.34: And they devoured all the grass in their land, and consumed all the fruit of their ground.
103.35: *And he slew all the first-born in their land: the first-fruits of all their labour.
103.36: *And he brought them out with silver and gold: and there was not among their tribes one that was feeble.
103.37: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them lay upon them.
103.38: *He spread a cloud for their protection, and fire to give them light in the night.
103.39: *They asked, and the quail came: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.
103.40: *He opened the rock, and waters flowed: rivers ran down in the dry land.
103.41: *Because he remembered his holy word, which he had spoken to his servant, Abraham.
103.42: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness.
103.43: And he gave them the lands of the Gentiles: and they possessed the labours of the people:
103.44: That they might observe his justifications, and seek after his law.

105.2: *Who shall declare the powers of the Lord? who shall set forth all his praises?
105.3: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and do justice at all times.
105.4: Remember us, O Lord, in the favour of thy people: visit us with thy salvation.
105.5: That we may see the good of thy chosen, that we may rejoice in the joy of thy nation: that thou mayst be praised with thy inheritance.
105.6: *We have sinned with our fathers: we have acted unjustly, we have wrought iniquity.
105.7: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt: they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies:
105.8: And he saved them for his own name's sake: that he might make his power known.
105.9: *And he rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up: and he led them through the depths, as in a wilderness.
105.10: And he saved them from the hand of them that hated them: and he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
105.11: *And the water covered them that afflicted them: there was not one of them left.
105.12: And they believed his words: and they sang his praises.
105.13: They had quickly done, they forgot his works: and they waited not for his counsel.
105.14: *And they coveted their desire in the desert: and they tempted God in the place without water.
105.15: *And he gave them their request: and sent fulness into their souls.
105.16: And they provoked Moses in the camp, Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
105.17: *The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan: and covered the congregation of Abiron.
105.18: And a fire was kindled in their congregation: the flame burned the wicked.
105.19: *They made also a calf in Horeb: and they adored the graven thing.
105.20: And they changed their glory into the likeness of a calf that eateth grass.
105.21: They forgot God, who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,  wondrous works in the land of Cham: terrible things in the Red Sea.
105.22: *And he said that he would destroy them: had not Moses, his chosen, stood before him in the breach:
105.23: And they set at nought the desirable land.
105.24: They believed not his word,  and they murmured in their tents: they hearkened not to the voice of the Lord.
105.25: *And he lifted up his hand over them: to overthrow them in the desert:
105.26: And to cast down their seed among the nations, and to scatter them in the countries.
105.27: They also were initiated to Beelphegor: and eat the sacrifices of the dead.
105.28: And they provoked him with their inventions: and destruction was multiplied among them.
105.29: *Then Phinees stood up, and pacified him: and the slaughter ceased.
105.30: And it was reputed to him unto justice, to generation and generation for evermore.
105.31: *They provoked him also at the waters of contradiction: and Moses was afflicted for their sakes:  because they exasperated his spirit.
105.32: And he distinguished with his lips.  They did not destroy the nations, of which the Lord spoke unto them.
105.33: And they were mingled among the heathens, and learned their works:  and served their idols, and it became a stumbling-block to them.
105.34: And they sacrificed their sons, and their daughters, to devils.
105.35: And they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons and of their daughters, which they sacrificed to the idols of Chanaan.
105.36: And the land was polluted with blood,  and was defiled with their works: and they went aside after their own inventions.
105.37: And the Lord was exceedingly angry with his people: and he abhorred his inheritance.
105.38: And he delivered them into the hands of the nations: and they that hated them had dominion over them.
105.39: And their enemies afflicted them: and they were humbled under their hands:  many times did he deliver them.
105.40: And he saw when they were in tribulation: and he heard their prayer.
105.41: *And he was mindful of his covenant: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
105.42: And he gave them unto mercies, in the sight of all those that had made them captives.
105.43: Save us, O Lord, our God: and gather us from among nations:
105.44: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say: So be it, so be it.

107.2: Let them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy: and gathered out of the countries,
107.3: From the rising and from the setting of the sun, from the north, and from the sea.
107.4: They wandered in a wilderness, in a place without water: they found not the way of a city for their habitation.
107.5: They were hungry and thirsty: their soul fainted in them.
107.6: And they cried to the Lord in their tribulation: and he delivered them out of their distresses.
107.7: And he led them into the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
107.8: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.
107.9: For he hath satisfied the empty soul, and hath filled the hungry soul with good things.
107.10: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death: bound in want and in iron.
107.11: Because they had exasperated the words of God: and provoked the counsel of the Most High:
107.12: And their heart was humbled with labours: they were weakened, and their was none to help them.
107.13: Then they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.
107.14: And he brought them out of darkness, and the shadow of death; and broke their bonds in sunder.
107.15: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.
107.16: Because he hath broken gates of brass, and burst iron bars.
107.17: He took them out of the way of their iniquity: for they were brought low for their injustices.
107.18: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat: and they drew nigh even to the gates of death.
107.19: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.
107.20: He sent his word, and healed them: and delivered them from their destructions.
107.21: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.
107.22: And let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise: and declare his works with joy.
107.23: They that go down to the sea in ships, doing business in the great waters:
107.24: These have seen the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.
107.25: He said the word, and there arose a storm of wind: and the waves thereof were lifted up.
107.26: They mount up to the heavens, and they go down to the depths: their soul pined away with evils.
107.27: They were troubled, and reeled like a drunken man: and all their wisdom was swallowed up.
107.28: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he brought them out of their distresses.
107.29: And he turned the storm into a breeze: and its waves were still.
107.30: And they rejoiced because they were still: and he brought them to the haven which they wished for.
107.31: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.
107.32: And let them exalt him in the church of the people: and praise him in the chair of the ancients.
107.33: He hath turned rivers into a wilderness: and the sources of water into dry ground:
107.34: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
107.35: He hath turned a wilderness into pools of water, and a dry land into water-springs.
107.36: And hath placed there the hungry; and they made a city for their habitation.
107.37: And they sowed fields, and planted vineyards: and they yielded fruit of birth.
107.38: And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly: and their cattle he suffered not to decrease.
107.39: Then they were brought to be few: and they were afflicted through the trouble of evils and sorrow.
107.40: Contempt was poured forth upon their princes: and he caused them to wander where there was no passing, and out of the way.
107.41: And he helped the poor out of poverty: and made him families like a flock of sheep.
107.42: *The just shall see, and shall rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
107.43: Who is wise, and will keep these things: and will understand the mercies of the Lord?

108.1: A canticle of a psalm for David himself.
108.2: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready: I will sing, and will give praise, with my glory.
108.3: Arise, my glory; arise, psaltery and harp: I will arise in the morning early.
108.4: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing unto thee among the nations.
108.5: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth even unto the clouds.
108.6: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory over all the earth:  that thy beloved may be delivered.
108.7: Save with thy right hand and hear me.  God hath spoken in his holiness:
108.8: Galaad is mine, and Manasses is mine and Ephraim the protection of my head.
108.9: Juda is my king:  Moab the pot of my hope.
108.10: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
108.11: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies?
108.12: O grant us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
108.13: Through God we shall do mightily: and he will bring our enemies to nothing.

109.1: Unto the end, a psalm for David.
109.2: O God, be not thou silent in my praise: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful man is opened against me.
109.3: They have spoken against with deceitful tongues; and they have compassed me about with words of hatred; and have fought against me without cause.
109.4: Instead of making me a return of love, they detracted me: but I gave myself to prayer.
109.5: And they repaid me evil for good: and hatred for my love.
109.6: Set thou the sinner over him: and may the devil stand at his right hand.
109.7: When he is judged, may he go out condemned; and may his prayer be turned to sin.
109.8: May his days be few: and his bishopric let another take.
109.9: May his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
109.10: Let his children be carried about vagabonds, and beg; and let them be cast out of their dwellings.
109.11: May the usurer search all his substance: and let strangers plunder his labours.
109.12: May there be none to help him: nor any one to pity his fatherless offspring.
109.13: May his posterity be cut off; in one generation may his name be blotted out.
109.14: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered in the sight of the Lord: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
109.15: May they be before the Lord continually, and let the memory of them perish from the earth:  because he remembered not to show mercy.
109.16: But persecuted the poor man and the beggar; and the broken in heart, to put him to death.
109.17: And he loved cursing, and it shall come unto him: and he would not have blessing, and it shall be far from him.
109.18: May it be unto him like a garment which covereth him; and like a girdle with which he is girded continually.
109.19: This is the work of them who detract me before the Lord; and who speak evils against my soul.
109.20: But thou, O Lord, do with for thy name's sake: because thy mercy is sweet.
109.21: Do thou deliver me,  for I am poor and needy, and my heart is troubled within me.
109.22: I am taken away like the shadow when it declineth: and I am shaken off as locusts.
109.23: My knees are weakened through fasting: and my flesh is changed for oil.
109.24: And I am become a reproach to them: they saw me and they shaked their heads.
109.25: Help me, O Lord, my God: save me according to thy mercy.
109.26: And let them know that this is thy hand: and that thou, O Lord, hast done it.
109.27: They will curse, and thou wilt bless: let them that rise up against me be confounded: but thy servant shall rejoice.
109.28: Let them that detract me be clothed with shame: and let them be covered with the their confusion as with a double cloak.
109.29: I will give great thanks to the Lord with my mouth; and in the midst of many I will praise him.
109.30: Because he hath stood at the right hand of the poor, to save my soul from persecutors.

110.2: The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.
110.3: With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength; in the brightness of the saints: from the womb before the day-star I begot thee.
110.4: The Lord hath sworn, and he will not repent: *Thou art a priest for ever, according to the order of Melchisedech.
110.5: The Lord at thy right hand hath broken kings in the day of his wrath.
110.6: He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins: he shall crush the heads in the land of the many.
110.7: He shall drink of the torrent in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.

111.2: Great are the works of the Lord: sought out according to all his wills
111.3: His work is praise and magnificence: and his justice continueth for ever and ever.
111.4: He hath made a remembrance of his wonderful works, being a merciful and gracious Lord:  he hath given food to them that fear him.
